intro: Ilex yunnanensis var. gentilis, commonly known as the Yunnan holly, is a deciduous evergreen shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
